intro: Robiquetia insectifera, commonly known as the insect-bearing rockrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique name reflects the presence of small insects on its flowers, which may play a role in pollination. Robiquetia insectifera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in drought-prone areas.
